snippet: The Senate’s Republican leader said he was focused on cutting spending, and he sidestepped questions about whether he would favor a government shutdown in the fight over raising the debt limit.
abstract: Senate minority leader Mitch McConnell makes clear in interviews that he will oppose any effort by Obama administration to raise more tax revenue and that he remains focused on finding ways to cut spending as government grapples with its debt.
lead_paragraph: The Senate’s Republican leader said he was focused on cutting spending, and he sidestepped questions about whether he would favor a government shutdown in the fight over raising the debt limit.

headline.seo: McConnell Says No to More Tax Increases
headline.main: McConnell Takes Taxes Off the Table in New Talks
headline.print_headline: McConnell Takes Taxes Off the Table In New Talks
